column1: The bull's-horn thorn does not grow at the mines in the forest
column2: nor are the small ants attending on them found there. They seem specially adapted for the tree
column3: and I have seen them nowhere else. Besides the little ants
column4: I found another ant that lives on these acacias
column5: whose habits appear to be rather different. It makes the holes of entrance to the thorns near the centre of one of each pair
column7: and it is not so active as the other species. It is also rather scarce; but when it does occur
column9: to the exclusion of the other. The glands on the acacia are also frequented by a small species of wasp. I sowed the seeds of the acacia in my garden
column10: and reared some young plants. Ants of many kinds were numerous; but none of them took to the thorns for shelter
column11: nor the glands and fruit-like bodies for food; for
column13: the species that attend on the thorns are not found in the forest.
